info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.graph.service
info.description:
graph/service api is query used to get monitoring information for service mesh of given application type. Service mesh is defined when ves.io/app_type label
is added to group of services or virtual_host. It returns graph which is set of nodes and edges. Each node represents service and
edge is access between services. Edges are directed from client to server. Two edges can be present for a given pair of service.
Only method post is supported. Query parameters are present in the request body. It is always scoped by namespace.

post.description: Request to get monitoring data for a service mesh of a given application.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

post.description: Request to get time-series cacheable data for HTTP-LBs.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "value"
namespace is used to scope load balancers. Only LB's in given namespace will be considered.

get.description:
Request to get list of application types for a given namespace.
For system namespace, all the application types for the tenant
will be returned in the response.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace

x-example: "value"
namespace is used to scope the listing of app types
For system namespace, all the app_types for the tenant will be returned in the response.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description:
x-example: "1570194000"
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
          If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description:
x-example: "1570197600"
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
          If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

app_typeAPIEPCategory.description:
The category of an API endpoint.

Discovered API Endpoint.
The API Endpoint is imported from user swagger.
The API Endpoint is present at the API Inventory.
The API Endpoint is considered as part of Shadow API.
Deprecated API Endpoint.
Non-API Endpoint.
app_typeAPIEPCategory.title: APIEP Category

app_typeAPIEPDynExample.description: List of Examples of expanded URL components for API endpoints that are collapsed with a dynamic component that is identified automatically
app_typeAPIEPDynExample.title: API endpoint dynamic example

component_examples.description:
List of sample URL(s) that are collapsed

Example: ` "[d0161a1e-044e-427b-a806-3bad9eac97fc, a74eb844-6d91-474c-9874-f19fa3983f4d]"`
component_examples.title: List of expanded URLs

component_identifier.description:
Dynamic component used to collapse sample URLs given in Expanded URLs

Example: ` "/api/v1/user_id/DYN"`
component_identifier.title: Dynamic component

app_typeAPIEPInfo.description:
Information about automatically identified API endpoint
Each identified API endpoint has a CollapsedURL and Method.
CollapsedURL is created by replacing dynamic components in the URL, if any, with the keyword DYN.
These dynamic components are automatically identified.
Additionally, any API endpoint that has a collapsedURL with automatically identified DYN components,
will also have DYN-Examples which show a few examples of the original values of the components that were determined to be DYN.
app_typeAPIEPInfo.title: Identified API

access_discovery_time.description:
access_discovery_time is the time when the API endpoint
 was updated from the access logs by the discovery mechanism.
 It is the UTC time and represented in RFC3339 form.
access_discovery_time.title: access_discovery_time

api_groups.description:
List of API Groups the API Endpoint is a member of.

Example: ` ["sensitive", "read-only"]`
api_groups.title: API Groups membership

attributes.description:
List of api endpoint attributes.

Example: ` [GraphQL, login etc.]`
attributes.title: attributes

authentication_types.description: List of authentication types found in the API endpoint and their locations.
authentication_types.title: authentication_types

avg_latency.description:
Average latency observed for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 2.34`
avg_latency.title: avg_latency

base_path.description:
The base path for this Endpoint.

Example: ` "/v1"`
base_path.title: base_path

category.description:
The category of the API Endpoint relative to API Inventory.

Example: ` APIEP_CATEGORY_DISCOVERED, APIEP_CATEGORY_INVENTORY`
category.title: Category

collapsed_url.description:
URL for automatically identified API

Example: ` "/api/v1/user_id/DYN/vehicle_id/DYN"`
collapsed_url.title: Identified API

compliances.description:
List of compliance frameworks of the Endpoint.

Example: ` ["GDPR", "HIPAA", "CCPA"]`
compliances.title: compliances

domains.description:
List of Domains of the API endpoint

Example: ` "[www.example1.com", "www.example2.com]"`
domains.title: List of domains

dyn_examples.title: Expanded URL(s)

engines.description:
List of engines that detected the endpoint.

Example: ` ["TRAFFIC_INSPECTION", "CODE_ANALYSIS", "CRAWLER"]`
engines.title: engines

err_rsp_count.description:
Number of request with 4xx or 5xx response for the API Endpoint

Example: ` 1234`
err_rsp_count.title: error status code count

has_learnt_schema.description:
Has Learnt Schema flag for request API endpoint.

Example: ` true`
has_learnt_schema.title: Has Learnt Schema

last_tested.description:
api testing last tested time is the time when the API endpoint
 was last tested
last_tested.title: last api testing

max_latency.description:
Maximum latency observed for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 9.87`
max_latency.title: max_latency

method.description:
HTTP method for the API.

Example: ` "GET"`
method.title: HTTP method

req_rate.description:
Request rate for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 10.5`
req_rate.title: req_rate

request_percentage.description:
Percentage of requests that were directed to this API Endpoint

Example: ` "78.5789"`
request_percentage.title: Request percentage

requests_count.description:
Number of requests seen for this API Endpoint for the specified time-range.

Example: ` "1234"`
requests_count.title: requests_count

schema_status.description:
Schema status indicates the API Endpoint's schema origin and if it's outdated.

Example: ` "Discovered Not-Updated"`
schema_status.title: schema_status

sec_events_count.description:
Number of sec_events seen for this API Endpoint for the specified time-range.

Example: ` "1234"`
sec_events_count.title: sec_events_count

List of Sensitive Data found in the API endpoint

Example: ` "[SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_CCN, SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_SSN, SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_IP]"`
sensitive_data.title: List of Sensitive Data

sensitive_data_location.description:
Sensitive data location for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` Request`
sensitive_data_location.title: sensitive data location

sensitive_data_types.description:
List of Sensitive Data found in the API endpoint

Example: ` "[Social-Security-Number, Credit-Card-Number]"`
sensitive_data_types.title: List of Sensitive Data

app_typeAPIEPPDFInfo.description:
Metrics supported currently are request_size response_size latency_with_data, latency_no_data.
PDF is calculated for each combination of (Tenant, App type, API endpoint).
API endpoint is determined from automatically identified API (collapsed_url) and method.
In the univariate case PDFSpec for each metric is repeated num_pdf_samples times.
num_pdf_samples is a parameter is system wide parameter currently set to 200.
app_typeAPIEPPDFInfo.title: Probability Density Function

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp represents the time when this PDF was created
 It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

error_rate.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for error rate
error_rate.title: PDF(error rate)

latency_no_data.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for latency of response begin
latency_no_data.title: PDF(response latency to first byte)

latency_with_data.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for latency of response end
latency_with_data.title: PDF(response latency)

request_rate.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for request rate
request_rate.title: PDF(request rate)

request_size.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for request size
request_size.title: PDF(request_size)

response_size.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for response size
response_size.title: PDF(response_size)

response_throughput.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for response throughput
response_throughput.title: PDF(response throughput)

app_typeAPIEPPIILevel.description:
API Endpoint's PII Level.

No PII data detected for the given API Endpoint.
Detected PII data for a given API Endpoint.
app_typeAPIEPPIILevel.title: APIEP PII Level

app_typeAPIEPSecurityRisk.description:
Signifies API Endpoint Security Risk Level

Security risk is not detected (for example, when no traffic).
API Endpoint has low security risk.
API Endpoint has medium security risk.
API Endpoint has high security risk.
API Endpoint has critical security risk.
app_typeAPIEPSecurityRisk.title: APIEP Security Risk

app_typeAPIType.description:
List of possible types of api that can be discovered for an APIEP.

The API Type detected as unknown.
The API Type detected as GraphQL.
The API Type detected as REST.
The API Type detected as gRPC.
app_typeAPIType.title: APIType

app_typeAuthenticationLocation.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication Location.

The API Endpoint authentication location is header.
The API Endpoint authentication location is query parameter.
The API Endpoint authentication location is request body.
The API Endpoint authentication location is cookie.
app_typeAuthenticationLocation.title: APIEP Authentication Location

app_typeAuthenticationState.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication State.

The API Endpoint authentication state is unknown.
The API Endpoint is authenticated
The API Endpoint is unauthenticated
app_typeAuthenticationState.title: APIEP Authentication State

app_typeAuthenticationType.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication Type.

The API Endpoint authentication type is Basic.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Bearer.
The API Endpoint authentication type is JWT.
The API Endpoint authentication type is API Key.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OAuth 2.0.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OpenID Connect Discovery.
The API Endpoint authentication type is HTTP.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OAuth 1.0.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Digest.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Negotiate.
app_typeAuthenticationType.title: APIEP Authentication Type

app_typeAuthenticationTypeLocPair.description: API Endpoint's Authentication Type and Location.
app_typeAuthenticationTypeLocPair.title: APIEP Authentication Type and Location Pair
app_typeAuthenticationTypeLocPair.x-displayname: API EP Authentication Type and Location Pair

auth_type.description:
The detected authentication type by string format

Example: ` "Basic"`
auth_type.title: auth_type

app_typePDFSpec.description:
Probability Density point in (PDF(x)) of the metric.
x is the value of the metric, probability is the corresponding PDF(x).
In the univariate case (current configuration), the value x of the metrics is a scaler.
As PDFSpec is repeated (see below), the x values are linearly spaced monotonically from minimum to maximum.
app_typePDFSpec.title: Probability Density Point(x,y)

probability.description:
Probability of given Value of the metric that can be plotted on y-axis

Example: ` "0.078"`
probability.title: Probability

x.description:
Value of the metric that can be plotted on x-axis

Example: ` "121.316"`
x.title: Metric Value

app_typePDFStat.description:
Probability Density Function statistics of the metric.
pdf_mean is the mean PDF of the metric, pdf_95 is the 95th percentile PDF of the metric.
In the univariate case PDFStat for each metric consists of pdf_mean and pdf_95.
app_typePDFStat.title: Probability Density Function Statistics

pdf_95.description:
pdf_95 represents the 95th percentile of PDF

Example: ` "0.078"`
pdf_95.title: PDF 95th Percentile

pdf_mean.description: pdf_mean represents the mean of PDF
pdf_mean.title: PDF Mean

app_typeRiskScore.description: Risk score of the vulnerabilities found for this API Endpoint.
app_typeRiskScore.title: RiskScore

score.description: Score of the vulnerabilities found for this API Endpoint.
score.title: score

app_typeSensitiveDataType.description:
List of possible types of sensitive data that can be discovered for an APIEP.

The Sensitive Data detected as credit card number.
The sensitive data detected as social security number.
The sensitive data detected as IP address.
The sensitive data detected as email address.
The sensitive data detected as phone number.
The sensitive data detected as credentials info(e.g password, username etc).
The sensitive data detected as information leakage.
The sensitive data detected as masked PII (CCN, SSN)
The sensitive data detected as Location.
app_typeSensitiveDataType.title: SensitiveDataType

graphQueryOp.description:
Match operators supported on a label

Indicates that the field is not set
Select timeseries whose label value exactly matches the specified string
Select timeseries whose label value does not match the specified string
graphQueryOp.title: Label Operator

graphserviceLabel.description:
Metrics used to construct the service graph are tagged with these labels and therefore
the service metrics can be sliced and diced based on one or more of these labels.

Indicates the field not being set
Identifies the source or destination site
Identifies the application type associated with the virtual host
Identifies the source or destination service.
For north-south traffic, source service is a network name (indicated by prefix "N:") and
virtual-service (indicated by prefix "S:") for east-west traffic; destination service is
always virtual-service.
Identifies the virtual host type.
Identifies the virtual host.
Virtual host should always be specified along with the type.
Identifies the VIP associated with a virtual host
Identifies the Cacheability associated with a virtual host
graphserviceLabel.title: Label

schemagraphMetricType.title: Metric Type

schemagraphMetricValue.description:
Each metric value consists of a timestamp and a value.
Timestamp in the Metric Value is based on the start_time, end_time and step in the request.
Valid values for timestamp are t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, t3=t2+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
Response may not contain values for all timestamps between start_time and end_time.
schemagraphMetricValue.title: Metric Value

serviceAppTypeInfo.description: List of application types for a namespace
serviceAppTypeInfo.title: AppTypeInfo

app_types.description:
List of app types running in the given namespace

Example: ` "value"`
app_types.title: App Types

namespace.description:
workspace where the applications are deployed

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: Namespace

serviceAppTypeListResponse.description:
Response for graph/service/app_types API that returns the list of app_types scoped by
namespace in the request. For system namespace, the response will contain the list of app types
for all namespaces.
serviceAppTypeListResponse.title: AppTypeListResponse

data.description: App Type data for a given namespace.
data.title: Data

serviceCacheableData.description: Cacheable Content Data wraps all the response data for a load balancer
serviceCacheableData.title: Cacheable Content Data

metric.description: List of metric specified in the request for a load balancer
metric.title: Metric

serviceCdnMetricData.description: CdnMetricData contains the metric type and the corresponding metric value(s)
serviceCdnMetricData.title: CDN Metric Data

serviceEdgeAPIEPData.description:
Details about the discovered API Endpoints between services.
Each discovered Endpoint has a collapsed URL and the associated method.
Probablity Density Function of request size, response size and latency
per API Endpoint is also returned.
serviceEdgeAPIEPData.title: Edge API Endpoint

serviceEdgeData.description: EdgeData wraps all the response data for an edge in the site graph response.
serviceEdgeData.title: Edge Data

serviceEdgeFieldData.description: EdgeFieldData wraps all the metric and the healthscore data for an edge.
serviceEdgeFieldData.title: Edge Field data

api_endpoints.description: Discovered API Endpoints between two services
api_endpoints.title: API Endpoints

serviceEdgeFieldSelector.description: EdgeFieldSelector is used to specify the list of fields that should be returned per edge in the response.
serviceEdgeFieldSelector.title: Edge Field Selector

serviceEdgeRequest.description:
While graph/service API is used to get the service mesh for an app_type,
where each node and edge contains the aggregated value for each field;
graph/service/edge API is used to get the time-series data (drill-down of aggregated data)
for each field.
serviceEdgeRequest.title: Service Edge Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: End time

namespace.description:
namespace is used to scope the application traffic to a given namespace.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

range.description:
range decides how far to go back in time to fetch values for each step.
 For example, if the range is 5m, then for step t1, query will be evaluated for t1-5m and for
 t2, query will be evaluated for t2-5m and so on.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Note: For non-timeseries query, i.e., for step=end_time-start_time, range should be set to end_time-start_time

 Optional: If not specified, range is set to 5m

Example: ` "10m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
range.title: Range

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "1570194000"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: Start time

step.description:
step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points [x-axis (time)] to be returned in the response.
 The timestamps in the response will be t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Optional: If not specified, then step size is evaluated to <end_time - start_time>

Example: ` "5m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_step: true
step.title: Step

serviceEdgeResponse.description:
Response for graph/service/edge API returns the time-series data for the service edge
specified in the request.
serviceEdgeResponse.title: Service Edge Response

step.description:
Actual step size used in the response. It could be higher than the requested step due to metric rollups and the query duration.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

Example: ` "30m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
step.title: step

serviceFieldSelector.description: FieldSelector is used to specify the list of fields to be returned in the response for site graph.
serviceFieldSelector.title: Field Selector

serviceGraphData.description:
GraphData wraps the response for the service graph request that contains
all the nodes and the edges. Each node contains the application traffic
flowing from/to service and each edge contains the application traffic flowing
from/to the source service and the destination service.
serviceGraphData.title: Graph Data

edges.description:
List of edges in the service graph. Each edge contains the application traffic
 flowing from/to the source service and the destination service.
edges.title: Edges

nodes.description:
List of nodes in the service graph. Each node contains the application traffic
 flowing from/to the service.
nodes.title: Nodes

serviceId.description: Id uniquely identifies a node or an edge in the service graph.
serviceId.title: Id

app_type.description:
Identifies the application type associated with the virtual host

Example: ` "myapp"`
app_type.title: App Type

cacheability.description:
Identifies the Cacheability associated with the Virtual Host

Example: ` "Cacheability"`
cacheability.title: CACHEABILITY

namespace.description:
Identifies the workspace where the service is deployed

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: Namespace

service.description:
Identifies the source or destination service

Example: ` "N:public or S:productpage"`
service.title: Service

site.description:
Identifies the source or destination site

Example: ` "ce01"`
site.title: Site

vip.description:
Identifies the VIP associated with the Virtual Host

Example: ` "192.168.1.1"`
vip.title: VIP

virtual_host_type.description:
Identifies the Virtual host type

Example: ` "HTTP_LOAD_BALANCER"`
virtual_host_type.title: Virtual Host Type

serviceIdField.description:
IdField is used to select one or more fields that uniquely identifies
a node or an edge in the service graph.

Indicates the field not being set
Identifies the workspace where the service is deployed
Identifies the source or destination site
Identifies the application type associated with the virtual host
Identifies the source or destination service.
For north-south traffic, source service is a network name (indicated by prefix "N:") and
virtual-service (indicated by prefix "S:") for east-west traffic; destination service is
always virtual-service.
Identifies the virtual host.
Identifies the virtual host type.
Identifies the VIP associated with the Virtual Host.
Identifies the Cacheability associated with the Virtual Host.
serviceIdField.title: Id Field

serviceInstanceData.description: InstanceData wraps all the response data for an instance in the graph response
serviceInstanceData.title: Instance Data

serviceInstanceRequest.description: Request to get the time-series data for an instance in the service node.
serviceInstanceRequest.title: Service Instance Request

Response for graph/service/node/instance API that returns the time-series data for a
service instance specified in the request.

Actual step size used in the response. It could be higher than the requested step due to metric rollups and the query duration.

end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.

group_by.description:
Aggregate data by any or all of NAMESPACE, SITE, APP_TYPE, SERVICE, INSTANCE and VIRTUAL_HOST

 Optional: If not specified, then the data is aggregated/grouped by all fields.
group_by.title: Group by

label_filter.description:
List of label filter expressions of the form "label key" QueryOp "value".
 Response will only contain data that matches all the conditions specified in the label_filter.

 Optional: To get the instances for an (app_type, service), user should specify LABEL_APP_TYPE and
           LABEL_SERVICE in the label_filter.

serviceLBCacheContentRequest.title: Cacheable Content Request

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`

  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: End time

field_selector.description:
Select fields to be returned in the response. 
 Optional: If not specified, only the following fields are returned in the response.
 REQUEST_RATE,  RESPONSE_THROUGHPUT.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.enum.in: [1,5]
field_selector.title: Field Selector

group_by.description:
Aggregate data by any or all of namespace, cacheability, vhost.

 Optional: If not specified, then the data is aggregated/grouped by vh_name.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 4
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
group_by.title: Group by

label_filter.description:
List of label filter expressions of the form "label key" QueryOp "value".
 Response will only contain data that matches all the conditions specified in the label_filter.
 For cacheable content, user should specify LABEL_VHOST_CACHE & LABEL_VHOST in the label_filter

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.min_items: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
label_filter.title: Label Filter

namespace is used to scope load balancers. Only LB's in given namespace will be considered.

serviceLabelFilter.description:
Metrics used to render the service graph are tagged with labels listed in the enum Label.
Label Filter is used to filter the timeseries that match the specified label key/value
and the operator.
serviceLabelFilter.title: Label Filter

serviceNodeData.description: NodeData wraps all the response data for a node in the site graph response.
serviceNodeData.title: Node Data

serviceNodeFieldSelector.title: Node Field Selector

serviceNodeRequest.description:
Request to get time-series data for a node in the service graph.
While graph/service API is used to get the service mesh for an app_type,
where each node and edge contains the aggregated value for each field;
graph/service/node API is used to get the time-series data (drill-down of aggregated data)
for each field.

serviceRequest.description: graph/service API is used to get service mesh graph of related services.

end_time.description:
end time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: End time

group_by.description:
Aggregate data by any or all of namespace, site, service, app_type and vhost.

 Optional: If not specified, then the data is aggregated/grouped by namespace and service.
group_by.title: Group by

is_trend_request.description:
Trend value computation requested by the user
 Optional: default is false

Example: ` "true"`
is_trend_request.x-displayname: Trend calculation requested by the user

label_filter.description:
List of label filter expressions of the form "label key" QueryOp "value".
 Response will only contain data that matches all the conditions specified in the label_filter.

 Optional: For service mesh graph, user should specify LABEL_APP_TYPE in the label_filter to avoid
           aggregation across all app_types for the given namespace.
label_filter.title: Label Filter

namespace.description:
namespace is used to scope service mesh. Only services and virtual_host in given namespace will be considered.

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

range.description:
range decides how far to go back in time to fetch values for each step.
 For example, if the range is 5m, then for step t1, query will be evaluated for t1-5m and for
 t2, query will be evaluated for t2-5m and so on.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Note: For non-timeseries query, i.e., for step=end_time-start_time, range should be set to end_time-start_time

 Optional: If not specified, range is set to 5m

Example: ` "10m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
range.title: Range

start_time.description:
start time of metric collection from which data will be considered to build graph.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "1570194000"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: Start time

step.description:
step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points [x-axis (time)] to be returned in the response.
 The timestamps in the response will be t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Optional: If not specified, then step size is evaluated to <end_time - start_time>

Example: ` "5m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_step: true
step.title: Step

serviceResponse.description:
Response for graph/service request contains a list of nodes and edges.
Each node represents unique combination of fields specified in group_by in the Request.
Each node respresents a service, if the group_by field in the Request is empty.
Each edge represents access between the nodes.
serviceResponse.title: Service Graph Response

step.description:
Actual step size used in the response. It could be higher than the requested step due to metric rollups and the query duration.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

Example: ` "30m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
step.title: step

serviceServiceRequestId.description: Service request ID to fetch metric for a specific service.
serviceServiceRequestId.title: Service Request ID

app_type.description:
Application type associated with the service

Example: ` "myapp"`
app_type.title: App Type

service.description:
Network name or name of the virtual service

Example: ` "S:productpage"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
service.title: Service

site.description:
Site name where the service is running. If the service is deployed
 in multiple sites, only the metric from this site will be returned
 in the response.

Example: ` "ce01"`
site.title: Site

vip.description:
VIP associated with the Virtual Host

Example: ` "192.160.1.1"`
vip.title: VIP

virtual_host.description:
virtual host associated with the service

Example: ` "productpage"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
virtual_host.title: Virtual Host

timeseriesTimeseriesFeature.description:
Various Timeseries Features that can be enabled

Do not enable any feature
Enable calculating confidence interval, upper and lower bound time series where metric is expected to vary.
detect anomalies and generate alarm when metric goes out of confidence interval
detect trend of the metric
Indicate a score between 0 to 100 which indicates if the metric is healthy
timeseriesTimeseriesFeature.title: Timeseries
